author: cheeky_gorilla
content:
Too early to say <@453080919255941139>! The first post-merge epoch finalized with a consistent participation rate compared to pre-merge, which is a great sign! But the second epoch post-merge has a lower participation rate, and devs are looking into why that is. Could be because of something as silly as the monitoring systems having a problem, or something more nefarious, too early to tell. 

You can follow via this URL: https://sepolia.beaconcha.in/charts/slotviz and here: https://sepolia.beaconcha.in/epochs

First post-merge epoch was 3600, you can see it finalized with 94.52% participation, compared to 94.57% pre-merge (epoch 3599). As per Danny Ryan, consistency is key here, so that's promising! But second epoch (3601) participation dropped to  68.48%. That's still enough for the chain to finalize (need to be more than 66%), so that's good, but obviously that number should be higher! Will wait for more info from devs!

author: tersec
content:
Another approach -- optimize choice of TTD/timing of TTD announcement with an optimization-view of that having a higher cost than has been effectively assumed so far, i.e. try as much as feasible to set a TTD that one can stick with, the first time.

Sure, it was difficult with these testnets with so little hashrate people could come in with 10x or 30x the hashrate individually, but on mainnet (and to a lesser extent goerli) it should be possible to arrange a TTD robust to this.
